actions.committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Telecommunications and Finance.

official_title: To repeal the provision added by the Cable Television Consumer Protection and Competition Act of 1992 prohibiting cable systems from retransmitting the signal of a broadcast station without consent.

summary.text: Cable Television Amendments Act of 1993 - Repeals a provision of the Communications Act of 1934 which prohibits a person from retransmitting to a foreign country a broadcast station signal for subsequent retransmission into the United States without obtaining a permit from the Federal Communications Commission.

titles.title: To repeal the provision added by the Cable Television Consumer Protection and Competition Act of 1992 prohibiting cable systems from retransmitting the signal of a broadcast station without consent.
